resources.string:
Choose Google if you only need a basic to-do list or don't mind having limited features when viewing your tasks from a web browser. Your tasks can be stored in your existing Google account at no charge and without having to set up another online account. Tasks are accessed from a browser at google.com/calendar. Google does not currently support storage of notes online - only tasks.


Choose Toodledo if you want advanced functionality when viewing your tasks from a web browser, or want to keep your notes stored online as well. Toodledo offers a free account with more features than Google, as well as paid accounts with additional features (such as subtasks).


You can also choose not to link to an online account. In this case, your tasks and notes will be lost if your device is lost or damaged. You can always establish a link later in the settings area.
This will delete all tasks and notes for the account. Are you sure?
This will delete all tasks and notes from your device. Toodledo will not be affected. Continue?
This will delete all tasks and notes from your device. Google Tasks will not be affected. Continue?

The app is set to automatically add new downloaded tasks to your calendar. If you have a large number of tasks in your online account, this will create a large number of calendar entries. You can adjust this settings in the New Task Defaults area of the app\'s settings. Do you want to continue?

Here are some tips for getting started with the app. Additional information can be found on our web site, at ToDoList.co.


To navigate through your lists, open the navigation drawer by tapping on the button at the top-left corner of your screen, or swiping from the left side of the screen towards the middle. You can access the navigation drawer while viewing any list of tasks or notes. Note that the drawer may always be visible if you have a tablet device.


To create a task or note, just tap on the + button. In general, if you're not sure what a button does, press and hold your finger on it until a message pops up to tell you.


If you need help, just tap on the Help button from the navigation drawer. Many useful resources are available, including the ability to search our support articles.


Ultimate To-Do List is highly customizable. If you're feeling overwhelmed with the number of features, you can turn off features you don't need in the settings area. The settings area also lets you customize the display, reminder, sync, and editing options.
Google folders cannot be deleted if they contain tasks (including completed tasks). Try removing the tasks from this folder or archiving it instead.
Are you sure you want to delete this folder? Any tasks and notes linked to this folder will be marked as having no folder.
Are you sure you want to delete this folder?

Your free Toodledo account imposes the following limitations. Upgrading to a paid account will remove these:

 Subtasks may be entered on your handset, but will not sync.

 Reminders will only sync if they are one hour before a task's due time. If a due time is omitted, reminders will sync if they are on the same day as the due date.
IMPORTANT: Ultimate To-Do List allows you to store tasks in \"Folders\" while Google uses \"Lists\". Each of your lists in your Google account will become a folder in Ultimate To-Do List.
Google Tasks must have a folder.

If you are having problems logging in, you may need to lower the security settings on your Google account. Log in from a web browser, go to your account security settings, then enable access for \"less secure apps\".

You can now upgrade your license to an in-app purchase and eliminate the need to download a separate app that holds the license. The upgraded license works on all of your Amazon devices, and travels with the app automatically as you upgrade or replace devices.\n
\nThis is an optional upgrade. You can continue to download the separate license even though it has been de-listed. There is no cost for this upgrade.

You can now upgrade your license to an in-app purchase and eliminate the need to download a separate app that holds the license. The upgraded license works on all of your Android devices - including smartphones and tablets - and travels with the app automatically as you upgrade or replace devices.\n
\nThis is an optional upgrade. You can continue to download the separate license even though it has been de-listed. The cost of this upgrade is $0.99 (the minimum allowed by Google).

You can now upgrade your license to an in-app purchase and eliminate the need to re-enter a registration code each time you install. The upgraded license works on all of your devices - including smartphones and tablets - and travels with the app automatically as you upgrade or replace devices.\n
\nThis is an optional upgrade. You can continue to enter registration codes if you prefer. The cost of this upgrade is $0.99 (the minimum allowed by Google).
Link with an Existing Toodledo Account
No need to push a button or say a trigger phrase.

Sorry, the folder cannot be changed because Google requires that this subtask be in the same folder as its parent. To change the folder, you must either move the task on Google\'s web site, change the folder of the parent task, or unlink this subtask from the parent.

Your device does not have a unique Android ID number, so we cannot offer the free trial at this time. To fix this, try going to your device\'s settings area and creating a Google account. Then, restart this application. If this does not work, you will need to purchase an Ultimate To-Do List License. Tap on the button below to purchase.\n
You have not specified a calendar to place tasks on.
Your device does not have any calendars.

Contexts allow you to assign tasks to certain locations, settings, or times of day in which they are to be completed. For example, "work", "shopping", and "evening" are some commonly used contexts.


The idea behind contexts is that it isn't productive to be reminded about tasks from one context when you are in another context. For example, when you are at work, you don't want to see all your tasks that can only be completed at home.


Tap on the + sign to create your first context.

Folders can be used to organize your tasks and notes into categories, projects, or areas of focus. Typical folders might represent broad categories such as \"Work\" or \"Personal\". Or, they could be more focused, such as \"Work / Project 1\" or \"Work / Project 2\".\n
\nTap on the + sign to create your first folder.

Goals provide a way to specify items you want to achieve. Unlike tasks, goals are usually more vague and difficult to quantify. For example: "Get a promotion", "Be a better parent", "Improve my health".


You can create lifelong, long-term and short-term goals and assign these goals to individual tasks. This will allow you to keep track of which actions contribute to your goals, and which actions may not be a good use of your time.


Tap on the + sign to create your first goal.
You do not have any Google accounts set up. You can set up a Google account in the \"Accounts and Sync\" area of your device\'s settings.
No Internet Connection - Voice Mode is Unavailable

Locations allow you to mark where certain tasks must be completed. This allows you to conveniently locate tasks that are nearby. You can also have the app remind you to work on a task when you reach a location.


When you tap on the "Show Map" button in the app's navigation pane, you can see which locations are closest to your current position, along with the tasks at each location.


Tap on the + sign to add your first location.
No locations have been set up.
Sorry, your device does not support speech recognition.
The task does not have a start or due date.

A tag is a keyword or phrase that you can use to help describe the task. Common uses include:


- Keeping track of the state or progress. Examples: "Step 1", "Waiting for response"


- Keeping track of the next step. Examples: "Return call", "Deliver item"


- Classifying the task. Examples: "Meeting", "Shopping"


- Your own organization scheme.


Unlike folders, contexts, and goals, a task can have more than one tag.


Tags are not created here. Instead, you can add a tag directly to a task using the task editor. This screen will show you to the most recent tags you have used.

The My Views area is where you can view your tasks any way you want. A \"View\" in this area consists of a set of memorized filter, sort, and display options.\n
\nYou can add views here from any list of tasks by choosing the \"Save this View\" command. You can also tap on the + button here to create a new view.

Browse and check-off tasks, snooze reminders, create and update tasks by voice.

The android wear add-on is available as an in-app purchase for $1.49 (US). The add-on may be purchased in the settings area.

Enabling the Add-On After Purchasing:

  • Open the Android Wear app on your handset and make sure Ultimate To-Do List is selected as the \"Take a Note\" app.
  • If you don\'t see Ultimate To-Do List listed, try going to Android Wear\'s settings and resyncing apps. If that doesn\'t work, restart Android Wear or reboot your handset.

How to View Your Tasks:

  • To show your default task list, say \"OK Google. Start Ultimate To-Do List.\"
  • You can also access your default task list by opening Ultimate To-Do List from the list of apps on your watch.
  • To view another task list, say \"OK Google. Note to self. Read\" followed by the name of a list, such as \"hotlist\" or \"all tasks\".
  • Once you have opened a task list, you can tap on tasks to check-them off.

Handling Reminders:

  • Reminders appear as notifications both on your handset and on your watch.
  • On your watch, swipe left on the reminder to reveal options to snooze the reminder and mark the task complete.

Using Voice Commands:

  • To create and update tasks by voice, say \"OK Google. Note to self.\" followed by the voice command.
  • Voice commands are identical to those used by the app\'s voice mode. To see a list of voice commands, tap on the microphone from any task list on your handset.

The Android Wear add-on gives your watch the ability to browse and check-off tasks, snooze reminders, and create and update tasks by voice.

Enabling the Add-On After Purchasing:

  • Open the Android Wear app on your handset and make sure Ultimate To-Do List is selected as the \"Take a Note\" app.
  • If you don\'t see Ultimate To-Do List listed, try going to Android Wear\'s settings and resyncing apps. If that doesn\'t work, restart Android Wear or reboot your handset.

How to View Your Tasks:

  • To show your default task list, say \"OK Google. Start Ultimate To-Do List.\"
  • You can also access your default task list by opening Ultimate To-Do List from the list of apps on your watch.
  • To view another task list, say \"OK Google. Note to self. Read\" followed by the name of a list, such as \"hotlist\" or \"all tasks\".
  • Once you have opened a task list, you can tap on tasks to check-them off.

Handling Reminders:

  • Reminders appear as notifications both on your handset and on your watch.
  • On your watch, swipe left on the reminder to reveal options to snooze the reminder and mark the task complete.

Using Voice Commands:

  • To create and update tasks by voice, say \"OK Google. Note to self.\" followed by the voice command.
  • Voice commands are identical to those used by the app\'s voice mode. To see a list of voice commands, tap on the microphone from any task list on your handset.

Unlocks the app so it can be used beyond the trial period.

Purchasing a license allows you to use Ultimate To-Do List beyond the free trial period. Your license is linked to your Google account. It works on all of your Android devices - including smartphones and tablets - and travels with the app automatically as you upgrade or replace devices.
Allows you to specify your own sort order for tasks. Includes synchronization.

The manual sort add-on gives you the ability to choose your own sort order. Once purchased, you can drag and drop tasks within a task list to set their order.

How to Perform Manual Sorting:

When viewing a task list, go to the sort order options and choose \"Manual Sort Order\" as the first sort order. Once this is done, you can either select the \"Manual Sort\" command from the task list or tap on the sort order button to begin sorting your tasks. Tasks are sorted by dragging and dropping them into their new locations.

Google Synchronization:

The manual sort order will synchronize with Google Tasks, but with a few limitations. Google keeps track of the sort order at the folder level, and Ultimate To-Do List keeps track of the sort order at the account level. This means that views that display tasks from multiple folders (such as the Hotlist or All Tasks list), will not show tasks in the exact same order that you see when logged into your Google account from a web browser. When viewing a single folder from Ultimate To-Do List, the views will be in sync.

The sort order of subtasks will be fully in sync with Google\'s web interface. The sort order also syncs fully with multiple devices.

Toodledo.com Synchronization:

Toodledo does not offer manual sorting capability. However, the manual sort order will synchronize with multiple devices running Ultimate To-Do List that are linked to the same Toodledo account. Toodledo does allow the sort order information to pass through its servers.

Toodledo does offer the ability to specify a sort order for subtasks. However, due to limits in the interface Toodledo provides to mobile apps, this sort order cannot be synced.

When the manual sort order is the first item here, then pressing the sort button in the task list will enter manual sort mode. You can still return to this screen by pressing the settings button after the sort button.
To use this feature, you will need to purchase the Android Wear add-on in the settings area of Ultimate To-Do List.
This Toodledo account does not have any collaborators.

To cancel the current command:

  • Cancel

To exit voice mode:

  • Exit

To launch voice mode from Google Search / Google Now:

  • OK Google. Note to self using voice mode.

Using the Android Wear Add-On:

  • The Android Wear add-on may be purchased in the settings area.
  • To show your default task list: \"OK Google. Start Ultimate To-Do List.\"
  • To open a specific task list: \"OK Google. Note to self. Read <List Name>\"
  • To create and modify tasks: \"OK Google. Note to self. <Voice Command...>\"

Reading Task Lists:

  • Read all tasks.
  • Read my hotlist.
  • Read due today and tomorrow.
  • Read tasks with \"next action\" status.
  • Read the \"Personal\" folder.
  • Read tasks with the \"Work\" context.
  • Read tasks with the \"Fitness\" goal.
  • Read tasks with the \"Meetings\" tag.
  • Read tasks at the \"Home\" location.
  • Read my \"Custom View\" view.
You not have permission to reassign the task, or the task is shared.
The task will be removed from your list after Toodledo receives the reassignment.
A shared task cannot be reassigned. You are free to edit the task and either remove sharing, or adjust who it is shared with.
You not have permission to share the task.
Show a daily summary every morning

A tag is a keyword or phrase that you can use to help describe the task. This can be used to keep track of the state or progress of a task, such as \"Waiting for Jim\" or \"Phase 1\". It could also be used to keep track of the next step that you need to take, like \"Call Jill\". Some people use the tag to classify the task. For example: \"reminder\", \"chore\" or \"meeting\".\n\nWhen you get here for the first time, you will need to type in your tags. After this, you can select your most recently used tags from a list.
Tap on an item to learn more.

Basic Task Creation:

  • \"Take out the trash\"
  • Create task \"Take out the trash\".
  • Create a task named \"Take out the trash\".

Setting Reminders:

  • Remind me to \"take out the trash\" on Monday at 8pm.
  • Remind me to \"take out the trash\" at 8pm and nag me.
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" with a reminder tomorrow at 8pm.
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" and remind me in 4 hours.
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" and remind me in 4 hours with nagging.

Setting Start and Due Dates:

  • Create task \"take out the trash\" with a due date of Monday at 8pm.
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" with a start date of November 1st.
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" starting today and due on Monday at 8pm.

Adding Repeating:

  • Create task \"take out the trash\" with a reminder on Monday at 8pm and repeat weekly.
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" starting Monday and repeat every 7 days from due date.
  • Create task \"exercise\" starting in 2 days and repeat every Tuesday and Friday from completion date.
  • Create task \"go to board meeting\" starting July 10 and repeat on the 2nd tuesday of each month.

Specifying Folders, Contexts, and More:

  • Create task \"take out the trash\" in the \"personal\" folder.
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" with the \"home\" context.
  • Create task \"exercise\" with the \"improve health\" goal.
  • Create task \"go to board meeting\" with the \"meetings\" tag.
  • Create task \"exercise\" in the \"personal tasks\" account.

Locations and Location-Based Reminders

  • Create task \"go to board meeting\" located at \"work\".
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" located at \"home\" with a reminder
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" located at \"home\" with a nagging reminder
  • Remind me to \"go to board meeting\" when I arrive at \"work\".
  • Remind me to \"go to board meeting\" when I get to \"work\" and nag me.

Other Attributes:

  • Create task \"go to board meeting\" with medium priority.
  • Create task \"write report\" with active status
  • Create task \"write report\" as a subtask of \"create project proposal\".
  • Create task \"meet with client\" and start the timer.
  • Create task \"take out the trash\" and add a star.
  • Create task \"go to board meeting\" starting on Friday at 8am and show in calendar.
  • Create task \"go to board meeting\" starting on Friday at 8am and add to calendar.

Using Combinations:

  • Create task \"write report\" in the \"work\" folder with top priority and a due date of the 23rd.
  • Create task \"weekly status report\" with the \"work\" context staring on Monday and repeat every week.
  • Create task \"write research paper\" with \"next action\" status with the \"school\" tag and add a star.

Completing a Task:

  • Mark the \"call Jim\" task as complete.
  • Mark task \"call Jim\" complete.
  • Mark \"call Jim\" complete.

Using the Timer:

  • Start the timer for \"meet with client\".
  • Stop the timer for \"meet with client\".

Changing Dates:

  • Postpone task \"write report\" to tomorrow. (This option adjusts all dates (start, due, and reminder) that the task is using.)
  • Change the due date for \"science homework\" to October 23rd.
  • Change start date for task \"board meeting\" to the 15th.
  • Change the reminder for \"take out the trash\" to Monday at 8pm.

Changing the Repeating Pattern:

  • Change the repeat for \"regular status report\" to every 2 weeks.
  • Change the repeat for task \"exercise\" to daily.

Locations and Location-Based Reminders:

  • Change the location for \"board meeting\" to \"building C\".
  • Add a location reminder to task \"board meeting\".
  • Add a location reminder to \"board meeting\" with nagging.
  • Remove the location reminder from task \"board meeting\".

Tags:

  • Add the tag \"household\" to \"take out the trash\".
  • Remove the tag \"personal\" from task \"take out the trash\".

The Star:

  • Add a star to the task \"take out the trash\".
  • Remove the star from \"take out the trash\".

Other Task Attributes:

  • Change the priority for \"write report\" to high.
  • Change the status for \"write report\" to planning.
  • Rename the task \"take out the trash\" to \"put out the garbage\".
  • Change the folder for \"take out the trash\" to "personal".
  • Change the context for the task \"take out the trash\" to \"home\".
  • Change the goal for \"exercise\" to \"improve health\".

Removing Attributes:

  • Change the status for \"write report\" to none.
  • Change the folder for \"write report\" to nothing.
  • Change the repeat for \"take out the trash\" to nothing.

You can upgrade your license to an in-app purchase and eliminate the need to enter a registration code or download a separate app that holds the license. The upgraded license works on all of your Android devices - including smartphones and tablets - and travels with the app automatically as you upgrade or replace devices.

This is an optional upgrade. You can continue to enter a registration code or download the separate license even though it has been de-listed.
Easier license management. Uses an in-app purchase instead of a separate download.
Say \"manage my list\" or tap on the microphone.

Please be aware that the Android Wear add-on is currently designed for English speakers. You can use the add-on in other languages, but any voice commands must be in English. Would you like to continue?
Welcome! The first step is to link to an online account. This gives you access to your tasks from a web browser, as well as other devices.

Version 3.4 Includes the Following Updates:

  • A new option is available in the Android wear add-on to send a daily summary of incomplete tasks to the watch.
  • Voice mode will now accept speech from a Bluetooth headset. Android 4.0 or later is required.
  • Updated the Android Wear add-on to support the latest versions of Google Play Services and Android Wear. This includes compatibility with multiple device setups.
  • Works around a bug in some Samsung devices running Android 5 that was causing a crash when the app starts up.
  • Fixed a bug in which widgets would not display all tags attached to a task.
  • Works around an issue with Google Tasks in which it will block uploading of tasks if the app sends too many tasks too quickly.
  • Fixed an issue in which the app would, on rare occasions, not understand a repeating pattern sent by Toodledo.
  • Fixed a bug in which headers in a task list that are based on the start or due date could be incorrect if the user changes time zones.
